meanings.definition: The Christian sacrament of initiation and adoption, almost invariably with the use of water, into the Christian Church generally, and also a particular Christian denomination.
meanings.sent1: During the baptism, the baby was welcomed into the church family.
meanings.sent2: The baptism ceremony was held in the beautiful church.
meanings.sent3: The baptism day was filled with joy and celebration.
meanings.sent4: Her baptism marked the beginning of her spiritual journey.
meanings.sent5: The priest explained the significance of baptism to the new members.

meanings.sent1: His baptism of the new believers was a special moment.
meanings.sent2: The priest performed the baptism with reverence.
meanings.sent3: The baptism took place in the calm river waters.
meanings.sent4: She felt honored to witness the baptism of her friend.
meanings.sent5: The baptism symbolized a fresh start for many in the congregation.

meanings.definition: A ceremonial immersion in water, as an initiatory rite or sacrament of the Christian Church.
meanings.sent1: The baptism by full immersion was a powerful experience.
meanings.sent2: The baptismal pool was prepared for the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The baptismal robes were white and pristine.
meanings.sent4: The baptismal waters cleansed the soul.
meanings.sent5: The community gathered to witness the baptismal service.
